header.article_title: New York's 24th Annual Pigeon Race Interrupted By Annoying Anti-Trump Protestors
header.author: Andrew T. Burcham
header.tags: New York | Pigeon | Donald Trump | Protests | Mayor de Blasio

body.p: NEW YORK CITY – New York City's annual pigeon last Saturday was ended prematurely this pass weekend after a large group of anti-Trump protestors crowded the streets, spooking the pigeons away. The pigeon race, founded by pigeon enthusiast, Henry J. Columbidae, in 1992 when he released 56 of his pet pigeons out into the street to see which one was the fastest. Since then, the Pigeon Race has been a New York City tradition where locals would join Columbidae by releasing their own pet pigeons in the race, the winner being crowned the "Winged Rat King of New York". More and more participate in the race each year, and it has even been supported officially as a state-holiday and televised on national television. This year, however, the race was stopped by a group of anti-Trump protestors who were solely looking to get on TV to rant about president-elect, Donald J. Trump. In their efforts, hundreds of trained pigeons became scared and flew away, causing widespread panic and a shortage of bread crumbs in the city. Mayor of New York City, Bill de Blasio, who took his daughter to watch the event, had this to say about it: "It is a real shame that these folks would ruin such a wholesome, family-friendly event to get their 15 minutes of fame. The pigeon race really has become something of a national holiday, free from the divisiveness of politics, and really should be treated with more respect." There is currently no word on whether or the not the Pigeon Race will be moved to a later date, but Columbidae has high hopes that this is a one-time event. "I know, just after the elections, it is a very stressful time in America," says Columbidae, "But like the pigeons that surround us in this great city, we must fly above our past lest we become the white bird poo that ruins someone’s day."I don't understand the last line. Maybe it could be a little clearer or maybe I am not understanding it.

report.p: The above satirical article talks about how Anti-Trump protestors have interrupted the infamous pigeon race that is held in New York every year. Right of the bat I think that you’ve done a good job in writing a hysterical article. Your title is a bit lengthy but apt for the article. I like the fact that you’ve provided your readers with a little history on how the pigeon race initially begun and became so famous, because I had no idea something like this existed before I read your article. I believe you’ve done a good job at following the schema which is why your article is, in my opinion, very well written. You’ve used every tag there is to which is nice, however I feel you need to break down your article into an introduction, main body and conclusion. Also, one think I did not understand was the very last sentence of your conclusion which is a quote. From what I understand, I do not think it is quite relevant to the article. Otherwise, I think your article is nice. I enjoyed reading it! Just look at breaking down your article into distinct paragraphs. It will, I think, enhance the presentation.
